intro: Hieracium holocomum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium holocomum is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions.
